subject: Re: new mapping proposal
msgSnippet: ... be ... read ... couple ... anything. ... ASCII ... alphabet. ... text ... version ... in ... avoid ... character? ... Coincidently ... font ... The design
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ted Larson Freeman"
<freeman@...> wrote:
>
> To my amazement, I find that I can read both of these! No one will
be
> surprised to hear me say that the one that is easiest for me to
read
> is QS-SAMPA. Obviously this is because I've been using it for a
couple
> of weeks and I've internalized it somewhat.
>
> (After all, some people teach themselves to read and write in the
> ROT13 cipher, replacing a -> n, b -> o, etc. We could learn
anything.
> In introducing newcomers to QS, the goal is not to give them an
ASCII
> version that they can read, but to give them an entirely new
alphabet.
> The artistry of the Read Alphabet should be emphasized--a plain-
text
> format we use for email and other software systems should be
> deemphasized.)
>
> Even better than direct readability, when I paste the QS-SAMPA
version
> into a word processor and change the font, I can read it directly
in
> QS. That's exactly what I want!
>
> Personally I think your proposal will be more persuasive if you
avoid
> diacritics, even as options. And why do you want a "null"
character?
>
> Ted
>
>
> On Dec 8, 2007 2:26 PM, peter_r_guinness <malt99@...> wrote:
> >
> > I see key mappings are currently being discussed again.
Coincidently
...
> > to use is 'Q' but use 'ö' to when wishing to improve english
font
> > readability.
>



The design goal of this mapping was not for directly aiding us
quikscripters when emailing each other, but rather for aiding people
who don't have quikscript fonts installed but come across a
quikscript document (especially on the web like own my page here:
http://kamibroke.sourceforge.net/). As well as being able to be
read by us quikscripters when using a quikscript font it is also
able to be read (with difficulty) by people who have never heard
about quikscript nor sampa and who only have english fonts
installed.

The reason that it maps some characters to null is so the those
letters disappear when changing the font to a quikscript font. This
mapping will display proper quikscript text if you cut and paste it
into a word processor and change the font!

Below is a more extreme mapping that uses more null characters. This
mapping is very readable by everyday english readers. I decided
against using this though, instead opting for a mapping that
minimises the number of multiple mappings and null mappings.

-----------
DÈE 3-riN rèlÈEs sistèm iz à paràSHUtê kômpOnènt Dat iz wIdêlý yUzd
bY spört skYdIvèrz tU àtaCH DÈE tU rIzèrz ov à mAÎn paràSHUtê tU DÈE
hRrnus Dat beárs DÈE lOÁd undèr DÈE paràSHUtê.

inventèd bY .bil bUTH, DÈE THrÈE-riN sistèm àlPz à skYdIvèr tU
kwiklý kut-àwAÝ à malfunkSHUniN mAÎn paràSHUtê wiTH à siNgul mOSHun.
skYdIvèrz yUZàlý nÈEd tU dU Dis kwiklý dyUriN èmèrjènsÈEz in wHiCH
DAÝ nÈEd tU dèplq à rèzèrvê paràSHUtê. DÈE THrÈE-riN sistèm iz
simpul, inèkspensivê, rèlIàbul, and rèkwIrz les fizikàl försê Dan
ôDèr paràSHUtê rèlÈEs sistèms.

DÈE lRrj botum riN iz sekyUrlý àtaCHt tU DÈE hRrnus wHiCH beárs DÈE
skYdIvèrz wAÎt, and iz kônektèd dIrektlý tU DÈE rIzèr bY DÈE midl
riN and rIzèr kloTH, wiCH iz in turn held bY à smöl riN and rIzèr
kloTH. DÈE smöl riN iz sèkyUàrd bY à körd lUp, THrU wHiCH à kAbul
runz hOldiN DÈE hOlê àsemblý in plAsê. rèlÈEsiN DÈE körd lUp bY
rèmUviN DÈE kAbul wiTH à tug közuz DÈE THrÈE-riN sistèm tU kaskAdê
frÈE and kwiklý diskônekt DÈE rIzèr from DÈE hRrnus.

ÈÁCH riN in DÈE siàriz multèplIz DÈE mèkanikàl àdvantij ov DÈE lUp
ov körd Dat iz held in plAsê bY DÈE semÈE-rijîd kAbul (à .lolon-ef
or teflon kOtèd stÈEl kAbul, dèpendiN on manyUfakCHurèr).
-----------------------------

The mapping is the same as before except:
Y <-> eye
ý <-> eat (actually it should really map to 'it' according to the
manual, but I'm using a strict australian accent)
P <-> out
H <-> null
áêîô <-> null
ÁÈÎÝ <-> null


peter
